title: Aleksandar Ignjovski
text:
Aleksandar Ignjovski (; born 27 January 1991) is a Serbian professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a> or <a href="right-back">right-back</a> for <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>, <a href="Socialist%20Republic%20of%20Serbia">SR Serbia</a>, <a href="Socialist%20Federal%20Republic%20of%20Yugoslavia">SFR Yugoslavia</a>, Ignjovski played in his first season as senior in 2008 for the <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> club <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a>, playing twenty three games and scoring three goals during that season. On 8 July 2009, he was loaned to <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> club <a href="TSV%201860%20Munich">TSV 1860 Munich</a>.
At the end of the loan, Ignjovski returned to Belgrade before signing for <a href="SV%20Werder%20Bremen">Werder Bremen</a>. On 1 April 2014, he stated his decision not renew his contract at the club. In this time at Werder Bremen, he made 60 league appearances scoring 1 goal.
On 3 April 2014, it was announced that Ignjovski had signed a three-year contract with <a href="Eintracht%20Frankfurt">Eintracht Frankfurt</a> with effect from the season 2014–15, where he was reunited with his former manager at Werder, <a href="Thomas%20Schaaf">Thomas Schaaf</a>. He made his debut for Frankfurt 23 August 2014 in a 1–0 win against <a href="SC%20Freiburg">SC Freiburg</a>.
In June 2016, Ignjovski signed for <a href="SC%20Freiburg">SC Freiburg</a>. He made his league debut for Freiburg on 28 August 2016 in a 2–1 loss to <a href="Hertha%20BSC">Hertha Berlin</a> being replaced by <a href="Onur%20Bulut%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201994%29">Onur Bulut</a> in the 66th minute.
On 21 July 2019, Ignjovski joined <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a> on a two-year deal.
International career.
Ignjovski was a member of <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Serbian U-21 team</a> from 2009. Due to his <a href="Macedonians%20%28ethnic%20group%29">Macedonian</a> background, in March 2010 <a href="Macedonia%20national%20football%20team">Macedonia national team</a> coach <a href="Mirsad%20Jonuz">Mirsad Jonuz</a> officially stated his desire to have him play for Macedonia however this never materialised. Instead, he made his debut for the <a href="Serbia%20national%20football%20team">Serbia national team</a> on 28 February 2012 in <a href="Larnaca">Larnaca</a>, Cyprus, in a friendly match against <a href="Armenia%20national%20football%20team">Armenia</a>.
